medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Chronic dermatitis developed at 1 month of age, confirmed by small-bowel biopsy showing total villous atrophy. Bullous lesions emerged at age 7, with widespread prurigo nodularis-like lesions appearing later. The patient has had episodes of blister formation and persistent pruritic nodules resistant to multiple treatments.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of autoimmune enteropathy, autoimmune polyendocrinopathy, recurrent sinopulmonary infections, and asthma. Laboratory findings include high titers of antithyroid antibodies, normal IgG levels, but defective antibody responses to polysaccharide antigens.
medical_history.family_history: Sole surviving affected male from a large kindred with IPEX.
